<title level="1" pfs="">[Prairie Drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1928)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

These squat, mud-brown drakes resemble scaly pit bulls with blunt, toothy snouts. The [desert drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=164) is the prairie drake's closest known relative, as both share a strong affinity for earth, can burrow through soil, and hack up balls of dirt that they aim at enemies. But whereas a desert drake is sleek and nimble, flying through lightning storms and siroccos with ease, the prairie drake has all the grace of a chicken, barely able to flutter clumsily up a low hill or over a boulder. Owing to their largely vestigial wings, it's no wonder prairie drakes prefer burrowing over soaring.

 The average prairie drake has a temperament similar to that of a wicked child who delights in tormenting others. They ambush tiny animals from underground and play with their food thoroughly before eating. To assert their supremacy over other scrubland predators, prairie drakes knock down their rivals and attack them mercilessly. They often make grisly displays from the corpses of their foes to intimidate other would-be competitors.

 Prairie drakes build and live in burrow mounds just beneath the surface of their environs. They make shallow tunnels in search of large insects, rodents, and ground snakes. Prairie drakes' presence helps to turn the topsoil and encourage new plant growth, supporting other animal life and making them a keystone species for the environment. Even their breath weapon leaves behind rich “drake soil,” coveted by farmers and gardeners for the potent effects it has on plants. Being seen as “useful” or “beneficial” annoys most prairie drakes, who believe such a reputation makes them look weak and conflicts with their “apex predator” mystique. After they've gotten too much positive attention, a prairie drake is apt to murder a farm animal or destroy croplands only to prove that they're far from harmless.

<title level="2" right="Creature 2">[Prairie Drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1928)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Dragon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=50" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #178: Punks in a Powderkeg](/Sources.aspx?ID=119) pg. 87</row>

**Perception** +6; [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) 30 feet (imprecise)

**Languages**
[Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +6, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +9, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +5, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +6

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +2

**Con** +4

**Int** -2

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +1
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 18 

**Fort** +10 

**Ref** +6 

**Will** +6 

</row>

**HP** 36

**Immunities**
[paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145)

**Resistances**
[electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56) 4

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, burrow 20 feet, fly 10 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +9,
**Damage** 1d6+6 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
wing +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 1d6+3 slashing

**Dirt Breath** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) The prairie drake spits a ball of dirt that explodes into a shower of rocks and mud. The attack has a range of 30 feet and explodes in a 5-foot radius burst. Creatures within the burst take 3d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 16 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). [Plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125) creatures in the area take no damage on a successful save; regardless, once per day, plant creatures can spend 10 minutes in the area to absorb the nutrients and heal 1d8 Hit Points. The prairie drake can't use Dirt Breath again for 1d6 rounds.

**Draconic Frenzy** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The prairie drake makes one jaws Strike and two wing Strikes in any order.

**Speed Surge** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Frequency** three times per day; **Effect** The prairie drake Strides or Burrows twice.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png">Drake Soil</title>

This nutrient-rich dirt is the result of a prairie drake's breath weapon. The first time they use their breath weapon after a large meal, they the especially enriched soil they spew out is enough to fill a sack weighing 1 Bulk and worth 1 gp to a farmer or gardener. A [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125) creature can nestle itself in a sack of enriched drake soil for 10 minutes to regain 1d8 Hit Points, using up all of the soil's additional nutrients.
</aside>
